title: Integrated Design-Analysis Strategy for Language Learning to Mitigate Self-Directed Online Learning (SPOL) Barriers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced language domain expertise (grammar systems, discourse analysis), practical application experience (project-based language task execution)
context.additional_context: Language education for practitioners in limited-technology environments, conducted via smartphones, with project-based assessments (job-related text analysis, workplace communication simulations).

learning_goals: Learners will diagnose weekly language learning patterns (reading/writing frequency, vocabulary acquisition trends) with 80% accuracy using learning analytics tools.
Learners will establish and execute self-directed language practice plans (pronunciation training, situational conversation exercises) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners will experience a process of improving their learning strategies twice or more based on real-time language learning feedback (grammar error analysis, expression diversity evaluation).

Learners will collect and analyze interaction data (meeting minutes, chat logs, feedback surveys) with peer learners during a team project, derive three collaboration improvement strategies (communication efficiency, feedback system, role distribution), and apply at least two of them in the next project cycle.

resources: Mini-project template for tracking learning outcomes
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
